title: Japanese Farmers' Cutting-Edge Techniques for Harvesting Giant Figs | Farming Documentary

tasks.task: Farmers propagate fig trees through grafting or cuttings.
subtasks: Selecting cuttings of the fig tree about 20-30 cm long.
Ensuring the selected cuttings are 0.5-0.7 cm thick.
Carefully cutting and planting the cuttings in pots.

tasks.task: Cultivating fig trees in appropriate environments.
subtasks: Planting fig trees in spring or early fall.
Choosing a full sun location when planting outdoors.
Ensuring the fig tree has enough space for deep root growth.

tasks.task: Harvesting figs when they are fully ripe.
subtasks: Inspecting figs for bright color and slight softness.
Picking only large, ripe figs for processing.

tasks.task: Processing figs in factories, focusing on drying techniques.
subtasks: Arranging harvested figs in trays for transport.
Transporting figs to processing facilities.
Drying figs in natural conditions on racks.
Packaging dried figs in various ways for different products.

tasks.task: Understanding the pollination process of fig trees.
subtasks: Recognizing the role of fig bees and wasps in pollination.
Knowing that each fig tree species is associated with specific pollinators.

tasks.task: 种植无花果树。
subtasks: 选择合适的无花果树枝条（20-30厘米长，0.5-0.7厘米厚）。
剪枝并种植在花盆中。
选择种植地点（室内或室外），春末或初秋进行种植。
为其提供充足的阳光。
确保土壤条件适合根部生长。

tasks.task: 采摘无花果。
subtasks: 当无花果变色并变软时采摘。
选取大而成熟的果实。

tasks.task: 处理无花果（如干燥）。
subtasks: 将果实放在托盘中运输。
将果实送往加工厂。
在自然条件下使用架子干燥果实。

tasks.task: 了解无花果的授粉过程。
subtasks: 识别与无花果特定品种相关的传粉蜂和寄生蜂。
理解传粉过程的重要性。
